abstract.para: Comparison of Arctic grayling growth in fertilized and unfertilized reaches of the Kuparuk river, June-August 1990.

intellectualRights.para: Acceptance and utilization of LTER data requires that:

listitem.para: The Principal Investigator be sent a notice stating reasons for acquiring any data and a description of the publication intentions.
The Principal Investigator of the data set be sent a copy of the report or manuscript prior to submission and be adequately cited in any resultant publications
A copy of any resultant publications should be sent to:Principal Investigator Ecosystems Center Marine Biological Laboratory Woods Hole, MA 02543

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: The Kuparuk River. Control zone, -0.1 to -1.2K; Fertilized zone, 2.0 to 2.6 K.

description.para:
For Archival Use:
DATE RECEIVED: 29Nov90 DATA FILE ENTERED BY: Julie Pallant DATA FILE VALIDATION: NAME: Julie Pallant DATE: 7Oct91

para.literalLayout: The response of fish to fertilization was determined by monitoring adult grayling from control and fertilized river reaches. Adult and juvenile fish within a 1 km zone in each section were weighed, measured, tagged and released. In August, tagged fish were recaptured to measure growth of individual fish. Wet weights are in grams, and were taken after holding the fish for 24 hours. Length is total length, using the bottom lobe of the caudal fin.

Notes: Fish weirs were not constructed on the Kuparuk this year. Adult fish seemed to move very little, as they were recaptured in August very close to where they were released in July. This may have been due to extreme low water levels. Juvenile fish in the control zone did move; many were recaptured upstream of where they were released. All fish tagged in July were not recaptured in August, therefore final length and weight measurements were not obtained for all fish. In July, juvenile fish were very abundant in the control zone. Only two were captured in the fertilized zone while the experiment was being set up. There were quite a few juveniles in the upper half of the fertilized section in August.
Calculations: Variable Formula LCHANGE RECAPL-LENGTH WTCHANGE RECAPWT-WEIGHT

Variable Variable description Precis./units Coded Missing Y/N Values SITE site of measurement y TAG# number on tag n COLOR Color of tag n TAGDATE date fish was tagged DDMMMYY n y LENGTH TL of fish in July .0/cm n WEIGHT weight of fish in July 0/g n FORC zone fish was in n D/D capture location .0/km n COMMENT initial capture comment n y RECPDATE date fish recaptured DDMMMYY n y RECAPD/D recapture location .0/km n y RECAPL TL at recapture .0/cm n y RECAPWT weight at recapture 0/g n y RCOMMENT recapture comments n y LCHANGE change in length .0/cm n y WTCHANGE change in weight 0/g n y
